Perfect for a last-minute breakfast treat\u2014no rising time required.", "prepTime": "PT30M", "cookTime": "PT25M", "totalTime": "PT55M", "nutrition": {"@type": "NutritionInformation", "servingSize": "1 bun", "calories": "389", "fatContent": "12 g", "carbohydrateContent": "66 g", "proteinContent": "6 g", "saturatedFatContent": "7 g", "unsaturatedFatContent": "", "sugarContent": "33 g", "fiberContent": "1 g", "sodiumContent": "296 mg", "cholesterolContent": "31 mg"}, "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Adjust oven rack to middle position and preheat oven to 425\u00b0F. Line a 9-inch square cake pan with aluminum foil and brush with one tablespoon butter. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/weekend-baking-quick-cinnamon-buns.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Combine the brown sugar, 3 tablespoons granulated sugar, cinnamon, cloves and \u215b teaspoon salt in a small bowl. Add one tablespoon of the melted butter and stir with a fork or fingers until the mixture resembles wet sand. Set aside.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/weekend-baking-quick-cinnamon-buns.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, remaining tablespoon granulated sugar, baking powder, baking soda and 1 teaspoon salt. Add the buttermilk and 3 tablespoons of the melted butter to the dry ingredients and stir with a wooden spoon until the liquid is absorbed; the dough will be sticky and shaggy. Transfer the dough to a lightly floured work surface. Knead, lightly dusting more flour as necessary, until just smooth and no longer shaggy, about 1 minute. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/weekend-baking-quick-cinnamon-buns.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Lightly dust the surface again. Pat the dough into a small rectangle, then roll into a 12x9-inch rectangle, dusting more flour sparingly if necessary so the dough doesn't stick to the rolling pin. Brush the dough with 1 tablespoon of the melted butter. Sprinkle the dough evenly with the brown sugar filling, leaving a \u00bd-inch border. Using your hand, press the filling firmly into the dough. Starting at the long side, roll the dough, pressing lightly, to form a tight log. (If the dough sticks to the surface, use a sharp knife or dough scraper to release it.) Pinch the seam to seal. Roll the log seam-side down and, using a sharp knife, cut it evenly into 9 pieces. Turn the pieces over on their flat sides, and slightly flatten each piece with your hand to seal the open edges and keep the filling in place. Place the rolls in the prepared pan and brush with the remaining butter. Bake until the edges are golden brown, 23 to 25 minutes. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/weekend-baking-quick-cinnamon-buns.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Meanwhile, make the glaze. In a medium bowl, whisk together the cream cheese and buttermilk until thick and smooth (the mixture will look like cottage cheese at first). Add the confectioners' sugar and whisk until smooth glaze forms. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/weekend-baking-quick-cinnamon-buns.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "When the buns are done, use the foil overhang to lift them out of the baking pan and onto a wire rack. Let cool for 5 minutes, then carefully separate the buns, using a knife if necessary. If you find the buns are sticking a bit to the foil, transfer them to a wire rack. Drizzle the glaze evenly over the buns. The buns are best served warm; leftovers may be stored in an airtight container at room temperature.  ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/weekend-baking-quick-cinnamon-buns.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}], "recipeIngredient": ["\u2154 cup dark brown sugar, packed", "3 tablespoons granulated sugar", "2 teaspoons ground cinnamon", "\u215b teaspoon ground cloves", "\u215b teaspoon salt", "1 tablespoon unsalted butter, melted", "3 cups all-purpose flour, spooned into measuring cup and leveled off with knife, plus more for dusting work surface", "1 tablespoon granulated sugar", "1\u00bc teaspoons baking powder", "\u00bd teaspoon baking soda", "1 teaspoon salt", "1\u00bc cups low fat buttermilk", "7 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted, divided", "1\u00bd tablespoons cream cheese, at room temperature", "2 tablespoons buttermilk or milk", "\u00be cup confectioners' sugar"], "recipeYield": "Makes 9 buns", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2012/04/Cinnamon-Buns-1200x1553.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2012/04/Cinnamon-Buns-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2012/04/Cinnamon-Buns-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2012/04/Cinnamon-Buns-480x270.jpg"], "citation": "Adapted from Cook's Illustrated", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 4.6, "ratingCount": "83"}, "datePublished": "2019-06-22T16:43:41-04:00", "keywords": "After School Snack, All Seasons, Christmas", "recipeCuisine": "American", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

When you transfer the brown butter to the bowl, try to leave as much of this sediment in the pan as possible but don't worry about it too much.)", "name": "In a small saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter and cook, swirling the pan occasionally, until the butter smells nutty and is golden brown, 3 to 5 minutes. (The bottoms brown more quickly than the tops, so keep the tops pale.) Remove the pan from the oven and let the madeleines cool in the pan for 3 to 4 minutes. Using a butter knife to lift up the edges, transfer the madeleines to a cooling rack, shell-side up, and cool for 10 to 15 minutes, or until the edges feel crisp. Serve warm, dusted with confectioners' sugar if desired. "ouac_cuisine", "label": "Cuisines", "description": "", "terms": [{"@id": 1128, "name": "American", "slug": "american"}]}]}]}, {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@id": "ouac-fv-recipe-23720", "@type": "Recipe", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": ""}, "name": "Easy High-Heat Roast Turkey With Gravy", "description": "Ideal for turkeys under 14 pounds, the high-heat method guarantees a juicy and crisp-skinned turkey.", "prepTime": "PT0M", "cookTime": "PT0M", "totalTime": "PT2H", "nutrition": {"@type": "NutritionInformation", "servingSize": "", "calories": "859", "fatContent": "39 g", "carbohydrateContent": "7 g", "proteinContent": "110 g", "saturatedFatContent": "13 g", "unsaturatedFatContent": "", "sugarContent": "2 g", "fiberContent": "1 g", "sodiumContent": "1,386 mg", "cholesterolContent": "385 mg"}, "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Before cooking, be sure that your oven is VERY clean to prevent smoking. Preheat the oven to 450\u00b0F and set an oven rack in the lowest position.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/easy-roast-turkey-with-gravy.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove and discard truss that holds turkey legs together. Trim off and discard any excess fat in the neck or body cavity. Remove giblets and neck; discard or save for stock.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/easy-roast-turkey-with-gravy.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Rinse the turkey inside and out with warm water. Pat dry with paper towels. Place a V-shaped rack in a 13 x 16 x 3-inch heavy stainless-steel roasting pan. (Do not use a dark roasting pan or a disposable aluminum pan.) Rub the turkey skin all over with the olive oil and sprinkle with the salt and pepper. Set the bird breast-side-up on the rack. Pull the wings away from the body, then firmly twist them to push the wing tips under the bird. Using aluminum foil, form caps over the tips of the end of each drumstick. (Do not tie the legs together, add stuffing, or close the body cavity.)\r\n\r\nInsert a digital leave-in meat thermometer near the center of the breast through the thickest part until the tip touches the bone.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/easy-roast-turkey-with-gravy.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Turn on your exhaust fan and crack a kitchen window. Place the turkey in the oven and roast, without basting, until the thermometer reaches 160\u00b0F, 1 to 1\u00bd hours. If your oven has hot spots, rotate the pan halfway through cooking to assure even browning. (If at any point your kitchen gets unbearably smoky or the fat is spitting, pour a cup of tepid water in the roasting pan. Just keep in mind that the liquid will create steam in the oven, so the skin won't be quite as crispy.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/easy-roast-turkey-with-gravy.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the pan from the oven. Using clean oven mitts (that you don't mind getting dirty), carefully tilt the turkey so that the juices from the cavity run into the roasting pan. Transfer the turkey to a platter or cutting board (do not clean the roasting pan), tent the turkey with foil, and let it rest for 20 to 30 minutes. This will allow the internal temperature to reach at least 165\u00b0F (the USDA safe-cooking temperature for turkey) and the juices to settle.  ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/easy-roast-turkey-with-gravy.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>While the turkey rests, make the gravy:</strong> Place the roasting pan on a burner on your stove. (Be very careful handling the pan; it's easy to forget that it's hot.) Skim away any excess fat or solids that have accumulated in the pan. Add the broth and cook over medium heat, scraping the bottom of the pan with a whisk or wooden spoon to loosen any brown bits, until simmering. Turn off the heat and set aside. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/easy-roast-turkey-with-gravy.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a medium sauce pan, melt the butter over medium-low heat. Add the onions and cook until very soft and translucent, about 15 minutes. Do not brown. Whisk in the flour and cook for 2 to 3 minutes, stirring occasionally. Whisk in the turkey dripping-chicken broth mixture and Cognac and cook, uncovered, stirring occasionally, for about 5 minutes or until thickened. Stir in the cream (if using) and chopped herbs. Taste and adjust seasoning with salt and pepper, if necessary. Transfer to a gravy bowl.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/easy-roast-turkey-with-gravy.html#fv-recipe-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<a style=\"background-color: #ffffff;\" href=\"http://www.seriouseats.com/2012/11/how-to-carve-a-turkey-thanksgiving-slideshow.html#show-284847\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Carve</a> the turkey and serve with the gravy on the side. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/easy-roast-turkey-with-gravy.html#fv-recipe-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Note: Nutritional information is based on an 11-pound turkey with 10 servings.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/easy-roast-turkey-with-gravy.html#fv-recipe-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>Make-Ahead Instructions:</strong> If you don't mind losing the crispy skin, the turkey can be roasted and carved ahead of time. Pour a thin layer of the gravy into an ovenproof serving platter. Arrange the carved turkey nicely on top of the gravy; cover tightly with plastic wrap and refrigerate for up to two days. Refrigerate the remaining gravy in a separate container. To reheat: remove the plastic wrap and cover the platter with aluminum foil. Place in a 325\u00b0F-oven for 20 to 30 minutes, until the turkey is hot. Reheat the gravy in the microwave or on the stovetop.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/easy-roast-turkey-with-gravy.html#fv-recipe-step-10"}], "recipeIngredient": ["1 fresh turkey (11 to 14 lbs)", "1 tablespoon olive oil", "1\u00bd tablespoons kosher salt", "1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper", "2\u00bc cups chicken broth", "8 tablespoons  (1 stick) unsalted butter", "1\u00bd cups finely chopped yellow onion, from 1 large yellow onion", "\u00bc cup all-purpose flour", "2 tablespoons  Cognac or brandy", "1 tablespoon heavy cream, optional", "1 tablespoon chopped fresh herbs (such as thyme, sage, rosemary, or parsley)", " 13 x 16 x 3-inch heavy stainless-steel roasting pan", " V-shaped roasting rack", " Leave-in digital meat thermometer, like this one"], "recipeYield": "8 to 10", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2018/11/Easy-Roast-Turkey-with-Gravy-101.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2018/11/Easy-Roast-Turkey-with-Gravy-101-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2018/11/Easy-Roast-Turkey-with-Gravy-101-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2018/11/Easy-Roast-Turkey-with-Gravy-101-480x270.jpg"], "citation": "High-heat turkey recipe adapted from Safeway; gravy adapted from Barefoot Contessa Family Style (Clarkson Potter, 2002)", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 4.83, "ratingCount": "46"}, "datePublished": "2018-11-11T18:22:07-05:00", "keywords": "Christmas, Fall, Thanksgiving, Winter", "recipeCuisine": "American", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

Add the eggs one at a time, stopping to scrape down the sides of the bowl between each addition. Beat in the vanilla (don't worry if the batter looks curdled). Add the ricotta cheese and mix on medium-low speed until incorporated. Scrape down the sides of the bowl and add the dry ingredients in one addition. Mix on low speed until just combined. Remove the bowl from the mixer. Using a rubber spatula, fold the chocolate chips into the batter until they are evenly dispersed, making sure to scrape the very bottom of the bowl. (You'll notice that the ricotta cheese gives the batter a slightly grainy texture.)", "name": "In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment or beaters, cream the butter and sugar on medium speed until light and fluffy, 2 to 3 minutes, scraping down the sides as necessary. Add the eggs one at a time, stopping to scrape down the sides of the bowl between each addition. Beat in the vanilla (don't worry if the batter looks curdled). Add the ricotta cheese and mix on medium-low speed until incorporated. Scrape down the sides of the bowl and add the dry ingredients in one addition. Mix on low speed until just combined. Remove the bowl from the mixer. Using a rubber spatula, fold the chocolate chips into the batter until they are evenly dispersed, making sure to scrape the very bottom of the bowl. (You'll notice that the ricotta cheese gives the batter a slightly grainy texture.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-chip-ricotta-cake.html#wprm-recipe-77123-step-0-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Transfer the batter to the prepared pan, and use an offset spatula to smooth and level out the top. Bake the cake for 55 to 65 minutes, until completely set and golden brown on top. (If the top starts to get too dark towards the end, cover the pan loosely with foil.) Place the pan on a cooling rack for 15 minutes. Run a thin knife around the edges of the pan to loosen the cake, if necessary, then remove the ring of the springform pan. Let the cake cool completely on the rack before cutting.", "name": "Transfer the batter to the prepared pan, and use an offset spatula to smooth and level out the top. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/flourless-chocolate-almond-cake-with-chocolate-ganache-frosting-a-k-a-queen-mothers-cake.html#fv-recipe-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Stir a large spoonful of the whites into the chocolate mixture to lighten it a bit. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/flourless-chocolate-almond-cake-with-chocolate-ganache-frosting-a-k-a-queen-mothers-cake.html#fv-recipe-step-11"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Release and remove the sides of the pan (do not cut around the sides with a knife\u2014it will make the rim of the cake messy). ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/flourless-chocolate-almond-cake-with-chocolate-ganache-frosting-a-k-a-queen-mothers-cake.html#fv-recipe-step-12"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "The cake will sink a little in the middle as it cools. Use a long, thin, sharp knife (I prefer serrated) and level the top. It will seem like you're cutting off a lot; don't worry about it. The finished cake should be about 1\u00bd inches high. Brush away any loose crumbs. Place a rack or a small board over the cake and carefully invert. Remove the bottom of the pan and the paper lining. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/flourless-chocolate-almond-cake-with-chocolate-ganache-frosting-a-k-a-queen-mothers-cake.html#fv-recipe-step-13"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "The cake is now upside down; this is the way it will be iced. Place 4 strips of the reserved parchment paper (each about 3x12 inches) around the edges of a cake plate. With a large, wide spatula, carefully transfer the cake to the plate; check to be sure that the cake is touching the paper all around (in order to keep the icing off the plate when you ice the cake). ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/flourless-chocolate-almond-cake-with-chocolate-ganache-frosting-a-k-a-queen-mothers-cake.html#fv-recipe-step-14"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To make the ganache frosting, heat the cream in a medium saucepan over medium heat until it boils. Add the espresso or coffee powder and whisk to dissolve. Add the chocolate and remove from the heat. Stir until all the chocolate is all melted and the mixture is smooth. Let the ganache stand at room temperature, stirring occasionally, for about 15 minutes, or until it begins to thicken. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/flourless-chocolate-almond-cake-with-chocolate-ganache-frosting-a-k-a-queen-mothers-cake.html#fv-recipe-step-15"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour the ganache slowly over the top of the cake. Using a long, narrow metal spatula, smooth the top and spread the icing so that a little runs down the sides of the cake (not too much\u2014the icing on the sides should be a much thinner layer than on the top). Smooth the sides with the spatula, then remove the parchment liners. "recipeIngredient": ["1\u2154 cups all-purpose flour, (spooned into measuring cup and leveled-off)", "\u00bd teaspoon salt", "2 tablespoons granulated sugar", "12 tablespoons (1\u00bd sticks) very cold unsalted butter, cut into 12 pieces", "\u00bc cup very cold water", "\u00be cup (packed) dark brown sugar", "\u00bc cup maple syrup", "4 tablespoons  unsalted butter, melted and cooled slightly", "1  large egg", "1 teaspoon apple cider vinegar", "1 teaspoon vanilla extract", "\u00bd teaspoon salt", "\u00bd cup \u00adchopped pecans, ((optional but highly recommended))", "3 tablespoons raisins ((optional))"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make the crust: In a food processor fitted with the metal blade, add the flour, salt, and sugar. Pulse briefly to combine. Add the cold butter and process just until you have pea-size clumps of butter, about 8 seconds. Sprinkle the cold water over the mixture and process just until moistened and clumpy, about 8 seconds. Transfer the dough to a lightly floured work surface and knead a few times, just until it comes together into a cohesive ball. Pat and knead the dough into a 6-inch (15-cm) disk, flouring and turning the dough as necessary so it doesn\u2019t stick. Wrap the dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or up to 3 days.", "name": "Make the crust: In a food processor fitted with the metal blade, add the flour, salt, and sugar. Pulse briefly to combine. Add the cold butter and process just until you have pea-size clumps of butter, about 8 seconds. Sprinkle the cold water over the mixture and process just until moistened and clumpy, about 8 seconds. Transfer the dough to a lightly floured work surface and knead a few times, just until it comes together into a cohesive ball. Pat and knead the dough into a 6-inch (15-cm) disk, flouring and turning the dough as necessary so it doesn\u2019t stick. Wrap the dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or up to 3 days.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/canadian-butter-tarts.html#wprm-recipe-74935-step-0-0"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 375\u00b0F (190\u00b0C) and set an oven rack in the middle position.", "name": "Preheat the oven to 375\u00b0F (190\u00b0C) and set an oven rack in the middle position.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/canadian-butter-tarts.html#wprm-recipe-74935-step-0-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Take the dough from the fridge and unwrap onto a lightly floured work surface. (If it&#39;s been in the fridge for longer than 30 minutes, you may need to knead it just a bit until it&#39;s malleable enough to roll.) Roll the dough to about \u215b inch thick, flouring and turning as necessary so it doesn&#39;t stick. Don&#39;t worry about the shape. Using a 4-inch (10-cm)-diameter cookie or biscuit cutter, cut the dough into as many circles as possible. Line each cup of an ungreased standard 12-cup muffin pan with one of the circles, gently nudging it down into the bottom creases of the pan. The top edge of the dough circle should come all the way up to the top of the cup. Gather the scraps and reroll the dough if you need additional \u00adcircles. Chill the pan in the freezer while you prepare the filling.", "name": "Take the dough from the fridge and unwrap onto a lightly floured work surface. (If it&#39;s been in the fridge for longer than 30 minutes, you may need to knead it just a bit until it&#39;s malleable enough to roll.) Roll the dough to about \u215b inch thick, flouring and turning as necessary so it doesn&#39;t stick. Don&#39;t worry about the shape. Using a 4-inch (10-cm)-diameter cookie or biscuit cutter, cut the dough into as many circles as possible. Line each cup of an ungreased standard 12-cup muffin pan with one of the circles, gently nudging it down into the bottom creases of the pan. The top edge of the dough circle should come all the way up to the top of the cup. Gather the scraps and reroll the dough if you need additional \u00adcircles. Chill the pan in the freezer while you prepare the filling.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/canadian-butter-tarts.html#wprm-recipe-74935-step-0-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make the Filling: In a medium bowl (preferably with a pouring spout), whisk together the brown sugar, maple syrup, butter, egg, vinegar, vanilla, and salt.", "name": "Make the Filling: In a medium bowl (preferably with a pouring spout), whisk together the brown sugar, maple syrup, butter, egg, vinegar, vanilla, and salt.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/canadian-butter-tarts.html#wprm-recipe-74935-step-0-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Divide the pecans and raisins (if using), among the pastry-lined muffin cups. Pour the filling evenly into the muffin cups. Bake for about 25 minutes, until the tarts are golden brown, bubbling, and set. Let cool on a wire rack for a few minutes, then run a butter knife around the edge of each tart to loosen. Let the tarts cool completely in the pan, then remove. Serve at room temperature.", "name": "Divide the pecans and raisins (if using), among the pastry-lined muffin cups. Pour the filling evenly into the muffin cups. Bake for about 25 minutes, until the tarts are golden brown, bubbling, and set. Let cool on a wire rack for a few minutes, then run a butter knife around the edge of each tart to loosen. Let the tarts cool completely in the pan, then remove. Arrange the dough balls about 2\u00bd in apart on the prepared baking sheets. Bake for 9 to 10 minutes, rotating the sheets from top to bottom and front to back midway through, until puffed and set. Let cool on the baking sheets for a few minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely. Store in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/old-fashioned-ginger-molasses-cookies.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Freezer-Friendly Instructions: The cookie dough can be frozen for up to 3 months: Roll the dough into balls, let set on a baking sheet in the freezer, then place in a sealable bag and press out as much air as possible. Bake as needed directly from the freezer. (Allow 1 to 2 minutes longer in the oven.) To freeze after baking: Let the cookies cool completely and store in an airtight container separating layers with parchment paper or aluminum foil. Before serving, remove the cookies from the container and let them come to room temperature.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/old-fashioned-ginger-molasses-cookies.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}], "recipeIngredient": ["2\u2153 cups  all-purpose flour ", "2 tsp  baking soda ", "\u00bc tsp  salt ", " 2 tsp  ground ginger ", "1 tsp  ground cinnamon ", "\u00bd tsp  ground allspice ", "\u00bc tsp  ground cloves ", "\u215b tsp  freshly ground black pepper ", "\u00be cup (1\u00bd sticks)  unsalted butter, at room temperature ", "\u00bc cup plus 2 Tbsp  granulated sugar ", "\u00bc cup plus 2 Tbsp  packed light brown sugar ", "1  egg ", "\u2153 cup  unsulphured molasses, such as Grandma's Original ", "\u00bd cup  raw sugar (also called turbinado or demerara sugar), for rolling cookies"], "recipeYield": "About 3 dozen cookies", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/12/ginger-molasses-cookies-1200x1602.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/12/ginger-molasses-cookies-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/12/ginger-molasses-cookies-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/12/ginger-molasses-cookies-480x270.jpg"], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 4.85, "ratingCount": "131"}, "datePublished": "2022-11-28T09:05:12-05:00", "keywords": "Christmas, Cookbook Recipe, Fall, For the Host/Hostess, Molasses, Thanksgiving, Winter", "recipeCuisine": "American", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

"HowToStep", "text": "Remove the husks and silks from the corn. Set one ear of corn aside. Use a knife to cut the kernels off of the remaining 5 cobs, then break the scraped cobs in half. Set aside.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/summer-corn-soup-with-fresh-herbs.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Melt the butter in a large pot over medium-low heat. Add the shallots and cook, stirring often, until soft and translucent, 8-10 minutes. Add the chicken stock, corn kernels, broken cobs, whole ear of corn, salt and pepper to the pot. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to medium-low and cook uncovered for 10 minutes. Remove the whole ear of corn and set aside to cool. Cook the soup for 10 minutes more, then remove the broken cobs from the pot and discard.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/summer-corn-soup-with-fresh-herbs.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Off the heat, use a hand held immersion blender to pur\u00e9e the soup until very smooth. It will take a few minutes. (Alternatively, let the soup cool slightly and pur\u00e9e it in batches in a blender. Be sure to crack the lid or remove the center cap to allow steam to escape and cover with a dishtowel so it won't splatter.) Place a fine mesh sieve over a large bowl and pass the soup through, using a back of a ladle to push the soup through in circular motions. Discard the fibers and bits of kernels in the sieve. Return the strained soup to a clean pot. It should have a creamy consistency. If it's too thick, thin it with water or chicken stock; if it's too thin, cook over medium heat until thickened.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/summer-corn-soup-with-fresh-herbs.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Use a knife to cut the cooked kernels off of the cooled whole cob, then add the kernels to the soup along with the herbs. Taste and adjust seasoning with salt and pepper (if necessary, you can add a bit of sugar to bring out the corn's natural sweetness). Ladle the soup into bowls and garnish with tiny sprigs of fresh basil and thyme, if desired. Serve hot or cold.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/summer-corn-soup-with-fresh-herbs.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>Note:</strong> If you have a high-powered blender, like a Vitamix, you may be able to skip the step of straining the soup.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/summer-corn-soup-with-fresh-herbs.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>Note:</strong> Be sure to get fresh-picked corn and cook it as soon as possible. As soon as it is picked, corn starts converting sugar to starch which reduces sweetness. If you're not going to cook it right away, store it in the refrigerator as it slows down the conversion process.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/summer-corn-soup-with-fresh-herbs.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>Freezer-Friendly Instructions:</strong> The soup can be frozen for up to 3 months. "recipeIngredient": ["500 g (3\u00be cups + 2 tablespoons) all-purpose flour (preferably King Arthur)", "12 g (2 teaspoons) fine sea salt", "350 g (1\u00bd cups) warm water (80\u00b0F/27\u00b0C)", "100 g (\u00bd cup) active sourdough starter (fed 4 to 6 hours ago, doubled in size, and bubby) OR levain (see instructions in the recipe notes)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Mix the Dough: In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the flour and salt. Add the water and 100g starter OR levain, then mix by hand, using a dough whisk, or a wooden spoon until no dry bits remain. The dough will feel shaggy, sticky, and rough. Cover loosely with a damp towel or plastic wrap and let rest for 1 hour\u2014this allows the flour to fully absorb the water and begin gluten development, making the dough easier to handle later. (This process, called autolyze, helps create a better texture and structure in the final loaf.)", "name": "Mix the Dough: In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the flour and salt. Add the water and 100g starter OR levain, then mix by hand, using a dough whisk, or a wooden spoon until no dry bits remain. The dough will feel shaggy, sticky, and rough. Cover loosely with a damp towel or plastic wrap and let rest for 1 hour\u2014this allows the flour to fully absorb the water and begin gluten development, making the dough easier to handle later. (This process, called autolyze, helps create a better texture and structure in the final loaf.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/sourdough-bread-recipe.html#wprm-recipe-73178-step-0-0"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Stretch and Fold: Moisten your hands with water to prevent sticking. With the dough in the bowl, lift one side, stretch it upward, and fold it over itself. Rotate the bowl and repeat on the other three sides. Cover loosely between rounds to prevent drying, and repeat 3 more times every 30 minutes over the next 2 hours (for a total of 4 stretch-and-fold sets).", "name": "Stretch and Fold: Moisten your hands with water to prevent sticking. With the dough in the bowl, lift one side, stretch it upward, and fold it over itself. Rotate the bowl and repeat on the other three sides. Cover loosely between rounds to prevent drying, and repeat 3 more times every 30 minutes over the next 2 hours (for a total of 4 stretch-and-fold sets).", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/sourdough-bread-recipe.html#wprm-recipe-73178-step-0-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bulk Fermentation: After the final fold, let the dough rest, still loosely covered and untouched, until it\u2019s puffy, slightly domed, and has increased by 50 to 75% in volume. The surface should look smooth with bubbles underneath and jiggle slightly when the bowl is gently shaken. This typically takes 2 to 3 hours, depending on temperature and starter activity.", "name": "Bulk Fermentation: After the final fold, let the dough rest, still loosely covered and untouched, until it\u2019s puffy, slightly domed, and has increased by 50 to 75% in volume. The surface should look smooth with bubbles underneath and jiggle slightly when the bowl is gently shaken. This typically takes 2 to 3 hours, depending on temperature and starter activity.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/sourdough-bread-recipe.html#wprm-recipe-73178-step-0-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pre-Shaping: Lightly flour a clean work surface to prevent sticking. Turn the dough out gently onto the floured surface, being careful not to deflate the air pockets. Use lightly floured hands or a bench scraper to shape the dough into a ball.Slide the bench scraper (or your hands) under one side of the dough. Gently pull it toward you while rotating slightly, using the scraper or your hands to tuck the edges under. Continue this circular motion, pulling the dough along the surface to create tension and form a smooth, round shape.Cover loosely with a clean kitchen towel or plastic wrap and let it relax on the counter for 15 minutes before final shaping.", "name": "Pre-Shaping: Lightly flour a clean work surface to prevent sticking. Turn the dough out gently onto the floured surface, being careful not to deflate the air pockets. Use lightly floured hands or a bench scraper to shape the dough into a ball.Slide the bench scraper (or your hands) under one side of the dough. Gently pull it toward you while rotating slightly, using the scraper or your hands to tuck the edges under. Continue this circular motion, pulling the dough along the surface to create tension and form a smooth, round shape.Cover loosely with a clean kitchen towel or plastic wrap and let it relax on the counter for 15 minutes before final shaping.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/sourdough-bread-recipe.html#wprm-recipe-73178-step-0-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Final Shaping: Lightly flour the top of the loaf, then use a bench scraper to flip it over so the floured side is down.Gently stretch and press the dough into a rough square. Take one corner and fold it toward the center, then repeat with the other three corners to form a loose package. Tuck and pinch any remaining seams into the center, then gently shape it into a ball. Flip the dough over (seam-side down). Using your hands, cup and roll the dough slightly toward you to create surface tension, keeping it tight but not tearing the skin. The dough should feel smooth, tight, and slightly tacky\u2014not too loose or sticky.Transfer the dough to a lightly floured banneton basket for proofing.Pro Tip: If you don\u2019t have a proofing basket, a medium mixing bowl (about 8 inches in diameter) lined with a clean kitchen towel works well. To prevent sticking, dust the towel generously with flour\u2014rice flour is ideal because it doesn\u2019t absorb moisture, creating a non-stick barrier. If you don\u2019t have rice flour, use a blend of all-purpose and cornstarch or simply more all-purpose flour, though it may be slightly more prone to sticking.", "name": "Final Shaping: Lightly flour the top of the loaf, then use a bench scraper to flip it over so the floured side is down.Gently stretch and press the dough into a rough square. Take one corner and fold it toward the center, then repeat with the other three corners to form a loose package. Tuck and pinch any remaining seams into the center, then gently shape it into a ball. Flip the dough over (seam-side down). Using your hands, cup and roll the dough slightly toward you to create surface tension, keeping it tight but not tearing the skin. The dough should feel smooth, tight, and slightly tacky\u2014not too loose or sticky.Transfer the dough to a lightly floured banneton basket for proofing.Pro Tip: If you don\u2019t have a proofing basket, a medium mixing bowl (about 8 inches in diameter) lined with a clean kitchen towel works well. To prevent sticking, dust the towel generously with flour\u2014rice flour is ideal because it doesn\u2019t absorb moisture, creating a non-stick barrier. If you don\u2019t have rice flour, use a blend of all-purpose and cornstarch or simply more all-purpose flour, though it may be slightly more prone to sticking.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/sourdough-bread-recipe.html#wprm-recipe-73178-step-0-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Proofing (Choose One Method - Room Temperature or Cold Proofing) Option 1: Room Temperature Proof (Faster)Cover with a lid or plastic wrap and proof at 75\u00b0F/24\u00b0C until slightly puffy but still firm, 1\u00bd to 3 hours. It\u2019s ready when it springs back slowly when pressed and has slight air pockets forming.Option 2: Cold Proof (Overnight for Better Flavor &amp; Handling)Cover with a lid or plastic wrap and refrigerate for 10 to 12 hours.Pro Tip: If life gets in the way, a slightly longer cold proof\u2014up 24 hours\u2014is usually fine. The dough may ferment a bit more, but as long as it still holds its shape and hasn\u2019t collapsed, it should still bake up beautifully.", "name": "Proofing (Choose One Method - Room Temperature or Cold Proofing) Option 1: Room Temperature Proof (Faster)Cover with a lid or plastic wrap and proof at 75\u00b0F/24\u00b0C until slightly puffy but still firm, 1\u00bd to 3 hours. It\u2019s ready when it springs back slowly when pressed and has slight air pockets forming.Option 2: Cold Proof (Overnight for Better Flavor &amp; Handling)Cover with a lid or plastic wrap and refrigerate for 10 to 12 hours.Pro Tip: If life gets in the way, a slightly longer cold proof\u2014up 24 hours\u2014is usually fine. The dough may ferment a bit more, but as long as it still holds its shape and hasn\u2019t collapsed, it should still bake up beautifully.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/sourdough-bread-recipe.html#wprm-recipe-73178-step-0-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake the Bread: Preheat the oven to 465\u00b0F (240\u00b0C) and set a rack in the lower middle position. Place a 5-quart Dutch oven or domed bread oven inside the oven to preheat as well.Place a sheet of parchment or a silicone bread sling over the proofing basket, then flip the dough onto it for an easy transfer. Using a lame or sharp knife, score the top about \u00bd-inch deep to control expansion during baking. You can use a single slash, cross, spiral, or decorative design.Carefully remove the hot Dutch oven and place it on a heat-proof surface.Lift the parchment paper or bread sling by the edges and lower the entire thing\u2014parchment/bread sling and dough together\u2014carefully into the hot Dutch oven. Cover with the lid and place in the oven (remember\u2014it\u2019s hot\u2014handle with oven mitts). Bake for 30 minutes. Remove the lid and bake for about 10 minutes longer, until golden brown.When done, the crust should be crisp and crackly, and the bread should sound hollow when tapped. Let the bread cool on a wire rack for at least 1 hour before slicing.", "name": "Bake the Bread: Preheat the oven to 465\u00b0F (240\u00b0C) and set a rack in the lower middle position. Place a 5-quart Dutch oven or domed bread oven inside the oven to preheat as well.Place a sheet of parchment or a silicone bread sling over the proofing basket, then flip the dough onto it for an easy transfer. Using a lame or sharp knife, score the top about \u00bd-inch deep to control expansion during baking. You can use a single slash, cross, spiral, or decorative design.Carefully remove the hot Dutch oven and place it on a heat-proof surface.Lift the parchment paper or bread sling by the edges and lower the entire thing\u2014parchment/bread sling and dough together\u2014carefully into the hot Dutch oven. Cover with the lid and place in the oven (remember\u2014it\u2019s hot\u2014handle with oven mitts). Bake for 30 minutes. Remove the lid and bake for about 10 minutes longer, until golden brown.When done, the crust should be crisp and crackly, and the bread should sound hollow when tapped. Let the bread cool on a wire rack for at least 1 hour before slicing.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/sourdough-bread-recipe.html#wprm-recipe-73178-step-0-6"}], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": "5", "ratingCount": "6", "reviewCount": "6"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "reviewBody": "Thank you for the tips. "PT15M", "cookTime": "PT0M", "totalTime": "PT30M", "nutrition": {"@type": "NutritionInformation", "servingSize": "1 palmier", "calories": "100", "fatContent": "6 g", "carbohydrateContent": "12 g", "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat your oven to 400\u00b0F and set an oven rack in the middle position. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/palmiers.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a small bowl, mix the granulated sugar, cinnamon, and salt.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/palmiers.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Sprinkle a clean surface with 2 tablespoons of the cinnamon-sugar mixture. Unfold one of the puff pastry sheets over the sugared surface. Roll it out slightly to a 9x12-inch rectangle, doing your best to smooth out the creases.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/palmiers.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Sprinkle \u00bc cup of the cinnamon sugar mixture evenly over the pastry. Using the rolling pin, roll over the sugar mixture a few times to press into the pastry. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/palmiers.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Roll the short sides of the dough toward center, so they meet in the middle. Flip the rolled pastry over and gently press together on the sides with your hands to form a compact roll about 2 inches in diameter. Repeat with the remaining pastry and cinnamon-sugar mixture. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/palmiers.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a sharp knife and sawing motion, cut the rolls into about \u00bd-inch slices. Place the slices on the prepared baking sheets, spacing them about 2 inches apart. If the rolls unravel a bit in the process, just roll them back together. Keep any additional rolls chilled in the refrigerator until you're ready to bake them. Bake for 12 minutes. Remove the pan from the oven and, using a metal spatula, carefully flip the palmiers over. Note that the caramelized sugar makes them extremely hot, so don't use your fingers to nudge them onto the spatula; use another utensil, such as a small spoon, if necessary. Place the pan back into the oven for another 5 to 6 minutes, until golden, puffed, and nicely caramelized on both sides.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/palmiers.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Allow the palmiers to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely. Repeat with remaining rolled dough. Store the cooled palmiers in an airtight container at room temperature. These treats are best enjoyed on the day they are baked but will keep for a few days. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/palmiers.html#fv-recipe-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make-Ahead/Freezer-Friendly Instructions: Palmiers can be prepared up to the slicing stage a day in advance. Once sliced, arrange them on a baking sheet, cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate until you're ready to bake. For freezing, prepare and slice the palmiers as per the recipe, then place the slices on a parchment-lined baking sheet without them touching. Freeze until firm, which should take a few hours. Once frozen, transfer the palmiers to a freezer-safe container, with layers separated by parchment paper, and freeze for up to 3 months. When you're ready to enjoy your palmiers, bake them straight from the freezer on a parchment-lined baking sheet, allowing a few extra minutes in the oven since they'll be baking from frozen.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/palmiers.html#fv-recipe-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pro Tip: The pastry should remain cold throughout the rolling and slicing process. If at any point it becomes too warm to easily work with, pop it in the fridge for a bit until cool.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/palmiers.html#fv-recipe-step-9"}], "recipeIngredient": ["\u00be cup  granulated sugar", "1\u00bd teaspoons  ground cinnamon", "\u215b teaspoon  salt", "1 (17.3-ounce) package (2 sheets) frozen puff pastry, thawed  (Pepperidge Farm recommended)"], "recipeYield": "30", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2023/12/palmiers-100-1200x962.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2023/12/palmiers-100-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2023/12/palmiers-100-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2023/12/palmiers-100-480x270.jpg"], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 4.71, "ratingCount": "7"}, "datePublished": "2024-12-22T09:06:48-05:00", "keywords": "", "recipeCuisine": "French", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

"prepTime": "PT45M", "cookTime": "PT45M", "totalTime": "PT90M", "recipeIngredient": ["1/2 cup (1 stick) unsalted butter, at room temperature", "\u00bc cup + 2 tablespoons sugar", "\u00bc teaspoon salt", "1\u00bc cups all-purpose flour, (spooned into measuring cup and leveled-off)", "1  large egg yolk", "8 oz semisweet chocolate, (best quality such as Ghiradelli, chopped or broken into small pieces)", "1\u00bc cups heavy cream", "2 tablespoons sugar", "\u00bc teaspoon salt", "2  large eggs, (at room temperature)", "1 teaspoon vanilla extract", "3 tablespoons heavy cream", "1 tablespoon light corn syrup", "2 oz semisweet chocolate, (best quality such as Ghiradelli, chopped or broken into small pieces)", "1 tablespoon hot water"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToSection", "name": "For the Crust", "itemListElement": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, cream the butter, sugar, and salt on medium speed until pale and creamy, about 2 minutes. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl with a rubber spatula. Add the flour and mix on low speed for about 30 seconds, until the flour is incorporated. The mixture will look like wet, clumpy sand. Add the egg yolk and mix on low speed until the yolk is evenly incorporated and the dough is clumpy, about 30 seconds. Using your hand, lightly knead the dough into a ball inside the bowl. Remove the dough from the bowl, press it into a 6-in (15-cm) disk, wrap it tightly in plastic wrap, and let it rest in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes.", "name": "In a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, cream the butter, sugar, and salt on medium speed until pale and creamy, about 2 minutes. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl with a rubber spatula. Add the flour and mix on low speed for about 30 seconds, until the flour is incorporated. The mixture will look like wet, clumpy sand. Add the egg yolk and mix on low speed until the yolk is evenly incorporated and the dough is clumpy, about 30 seconds. Using your hand, lightly knead the dough into a ball inside the bowl. Remove the dough from the bowl, press it into a 6-in (15-cm) disk, wrap it tightly in plastic wrap, and let it rest in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-tart.html#wprm-recipe-77361-step-0-0"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Lightly spray a 9.5-in (24-cm) tart pan with a removable bottom with nonstick cooking spray. Pinch off pieces of dough and press them against the sides of the pan to reach between \u215b and \u00bc-in (3 and 6-mm)-thick. Using the heel of your hand, press the rest of the dough evenly into the bottom of the pan. (It will look like a mess, and it may initially seem like you won&#39;t have enough dough, but have faith, it will come together. If you run out of dough, you\u2019ve made the crust too thick.) Be sure there are no seams in the dough and press it squarely along the corners where the bottom meets the sides of the pan to avoid extra-thick edges. Use a paring knife to trim the top edge of the dough so it is even with the rim of the pan. Press any scraps into the bottom crust. Cover with plastic wrap and place in the freezer for at least 30 minutes.", "name": "Lightly spray a 9.5-in (24-cm) tart pan with a removable bottom with nonstick cooking spray. Pinch off pieces of dough and press them against the sides of the pan to reach between \u215b and \u00bc-in (3 and 6-mm)-thick. Using the heel of your hand, press the rest of the dough evenly into the bottom of the pan. (It will look like a mess, and it may initially seem like you won&#39;t have enough dough, but have faith, it will come together. If you run out of dough, you\u2019ve made the crust too thick.) Be sure there are no seams in the dough and press it squarely along the corners where the bottom meets the sides of the pan to avoid extra-thick edges. Use a paring knife to trim the top edge of the dough so it is even with the rim of the pan. Press any scraps into the bottom crust. Cover with plastic wrap and place in the freezer for at least 30 minutes.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-tart.html#wprm-recipe-77361-step-0-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F (175\u00b0C) and set an oven rack in the middle position.", "name": "Preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F (175\u00b0C) and set an oven rack in the middle position.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-tart.html#wprm-recipe-77361-step-0-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the chilled crust on a baking sheet (for easy handling) and bake until dry and very lightly golden, about 20 minutes. Let cool on the baking sheet on a wire rack while you prepare the filling.", "name": "Place the chilled crust on a baking sheet (for easy handling) and bake until dry and very lightly golden, about 20 minutes. Let cool on the baking sheet on a wire rack while you prepare the filling.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-tart.html#wprm-recipe-77361-step-0-3"}]}, {"@type": "HowToSection", "name": "For the Chocolate Filling", "itemListElement": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the chocolate in a medium bowl. In a small saucepan, bring the heavy cream to a boil. Pour over the chocolate and let sit for a few minutes, then whisk until melted and smooth. Add the sugar and salt and whisk until well incorporated. Add the eggs and vanilla and whisk until completely smooth. Pour the filling into the baked tart shell and pop any air bubbles with a toothpick. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes, until the filling is mostly set but still a bit wobbly in the center. Let cool completely in the pan on a wire rack, about 1 hour. The tart can be refrigerated at this point for up to 2 days (but bring to room temperature before glazing).", "name": "Place the chocolate in a medium bowl. In a small saucepan, bring the heavy cream to a boil. Pour over the chocolate and let sit for a few minutes, then whisk until melted and smooth. Add the sugar and salt and whisk until well incorporated. Add the eggs and vanilla and whisk until completely smooth. Pour the filling into the baked tart shell and pop any air bubbles with a toothpick. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes, until the filling is mostly set but still a bit wobbly in the center. Let cool completely in the pan on a wire rack, about 1 hour. The tart can be refrigerated at this point for up to 2 days (but bring to room temperature before glazing).", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-tart.html#wprm-recipe-77361-step-1-0"}]}, {"@type": "HowToSection", "name": "For the Chocolate Glaze", "itemListElement": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "On the day of serving, pour the cream and corn syrup into a medium microwave-safe bowl. Microwave on high until boiling, 30 seconds to 1 minute. Add the chocolate and let stand for a few minutes to allow the chocolate to soften. Whisk gently until the chocolate is melted and smooth, then whisk in the hot water. Working quickly so it doesn\u2019t cool and thicken, pour the glaze onto the center of the tart, then carefully tilt the tart around to allow the glaze to run evenly to the edges. Let stand until the glaze is set, about 1 hour, and leave out at room temperature until serving.", "name": "On the day of serving, pour the cream and corn syrup into a medium microwave-safe bowl. Microwave on high until boiling, 30 seconds to 1 minute. Add the chocolate and let stand for a few minutes to allow the chocolate to soften. Whisk gently until the chocolate is melted and smooth, then whisk in the hot water. Working quickly so it doesn\u2019t cool and thicken, pour the glaze onto the center of the tart, then carefully tilt the tart around to allow the glaze to run evenly to the edges. Let stand until the glaze is set, about 1 hour, and leave out at room temperature until serving.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-tart.html#wprm-recipe-77361-step-2-0"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the outer ring from the tart pan. Insert a metal spatula between the crust and pan bottom to loosen the tart and slide it onto a serving platter (or just leave the bottom in place). Cut into wedges, wiping the knife clean between slices, and serve plain or with sweetened whipped cream. Leftovers will keep nicely in a covered container in the refrigerator for up to 4 days (although the glaze will lose its sheen).", "name": "Remove the outer ring from the tart pan. Insert a metal spatula between the crust and pan bottom to loosen the tart and slide it onto a serving platter (or just leave the bottom in place). Add the cooked rice, peas, broccoli, fish sauce, oyster sauce, sugar, and red pepper flakes. Cook, stirring to evenly combine, until the rice and vegetables are hot. Stir in the dark scallion greens, cilantro and scrambled eggs. Taste and adjust seasoning, if necessary. Serve with Sriracha, if desired. Transfer the salmon fillets to the prepared baking sheet, skin side down, and drizzle a bit of the marinade over top. Broil the salmon for 6 to 10 minutes, or until browned in spots and almost opaque in the center. Transfer the salmon to a serving platter and pour the reserved sauce over top. Garnish with scallions and serve.", "name": "Line a rimmed baking sheet with aluminum foil and spray with nonstick cooking spray. Transfer the salmon fillets to the prepared baking sheet, skin side down, and drizzle a bit of the marinade over top. Go easy\u2014you don&#39;t want it to pool too much on the baking sheet because it will burn in the oven. Broil the salmon for 6 to 10 minutes, or until browned in spots and almost opaque in the center. Transfer the salmon to a serving platter and pour the reserved sauce over top. pomegranate ((or 1\u00be/290 g cups ready-to-eat pomegranate arils), with juices)", "2  large navel oranges", "2  pink grapefruits", "1 tablespoon sugar, (if needed)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the pomegranate on a surface that won\u2019t stain. Starting at the crown, cut a cross into the fruit about halfway down. Put a large bowl in the sink and, holding the pomegranate crown side down over the bowl, break it apart into quarters. Squeeze each quarter firmly over the bowl to release the seeds and juice, then bend each quarter back to release more seeds. (Don\u2019t worry about getting all the seeds out. What you really want is the juice, so squeeze the pomegranate again to release the juice from any remaining seeds still attached to the fruit.) Pick out any bits of the white membrane so all that remains in the bowl are seeds and juice.", "name": "Place the pomegranate on a surface that won\u2019t stain. Starting at the crown, cut a cross into the fruit about halfway down. Put a large bowl in the sink and, holding the pomegranate crown side down over the bowl, break it apart into quarters. Squeeze each quarter firmly over the bowl to release the seeds and juice, then bend each quarter back to release more seeds. (Don\u2019t worry about getting all the seeds out. What you really want is the juice, so squeeze the pomegranate again to release the juice from any remaining seeds still attached to the fruit.) Pick out any bits of the white membrane so all that remains in the bowl are seeds and juice.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/citrus-and-pomegranate-fruit-salad.html#wprm-recipe-77535-step-0-0"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "For the oranges and grapefruits, cut a slice off the top and bottom of each fruit so they sit flat on a cutting board. Using a sharp knife, work your way around the fruits to remove all the skin and pith. Cupping the fruit in one hand and working over the bowl, carefully cut the segments out from between the membranes. (Be sure to cut only until you reach the middle of the fruit!) Firmly squeeze the remaining membranes over the bowl to release all the juices. Taste the fruit salad and add up to 1 tablespoon of sugar, only if necessary. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve the fruit salad in bowls so the juice can be spooned up with the fruit.", "name": "For the oranges and grapefruits, cut a slice off the top and bottom of each fruit so they sit flat on a cutting board. Using a sharp knife, work your way around the fruits to remove all the skin and pith. Cupping the fruit in one hand and working over the bowl, carefully cut the segments out from between the membranes. (Be sure to cut only until you reach the middle of the fruit!) Firmly squeeze the remaining membranes over the bowl to release all the juices. Taste the fruit salad and add up to 1 tablespoon of sugar, only if necessary. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve the fruit salad in bowls so the juice can be spooned up with the fruit.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/citrus-and-pomegranate-fruit-salad.html#wprm-recipe-77535-step-0-1"}], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": "4.91", "ratingCount": "22", "reviewCount": "10"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "reviewBody": "Had everything on hand so I made this. Pull apart the skin, and gently nudge the seeds out. All those beautiful juicy kernels will fall out without creating a mess\u2026.and pieces of the membrane and bad seeds will float to the top, so pour those off with some of the water into the sink. (For medium, cook 4 to 5 minutes on second side; for well-done, cook 5 to 6 minutes on second side). {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@id": "ouac-fv-recipe-20688", "@type": "Recipe", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Jennifer Segal"}, "name": "Classic New York Cheesecake Recipe", "description": "This easy, foolproof cheesecake recipe creates a dense, rich, and creamy dessert with irresistible flavor\u2014perfect for any occasion and sure to impress.", "prepTime": "PT30M", "cookTime": "PT1H55M", "totalTime": "PT2H25M", "nutrition": {"@type": "NutritionInformation", "servingSize": "1 slice", "calories": "659", "fatContent": "43 g", "carbohydrateContent": "59 g", "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 375\u00b0F and set an oven rack in the lower middle position. Wrap a 9- or 10-inch springform pan with one large piece of heavy-duty aluminum foil, covering the underside and extending all the way to the top so there are no seams on the bottom or sides of the pan. Repeat with another sheet of foil for insurance. Spray the inside of the pan with nonstick cooking spray.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/new-york-style-cheesecake.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make the crust: In a medium bowl, combine the graham cracker crumbs, melted butter, sugar, and salt. Stir until well combined. Press the crumbs into an even layer on the the bottom of the prepared pan. Bake the crust for 10 minutes, until set. Remove the pan from the oven and set aside.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/new-york-style-cheesecake.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Reduce the oven temperature to 325\u00b0F. Set a kettle of water to boil.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/new-york-style-cheesecake.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make the batter: In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment or beaters, beat the cream cheese, sugar, and flour together on medium speed until just smooth, about 1 minute. Scrape the bottom and sides of the bowl to be sure the mixture is evenly combined. Add the vanilla, lemon zest, lemon juice, and salt; beat on low speed until just combined. Add the eggs, one at a time, mixing on low speed until incorporated, scraping the bowl as necessary. Mix in the sour cream. Make sure the batter is uniform but do not over-mix.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/new-york-style-cheesecake.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Check to make sure your oven has cooled to 325\u00b0F, then set the cheesecake pan in a large roasting pan. Pour the batter on top of  the crust. Pour the boiling water into the large roasting pan to come about 1 inch up the side of the cake pan. Bake until the cake is just set, 1 hour and 30 minutes to 1 hour and 45 minutes. (If the cheesecake starts to look too golden on top towards the end, cover it loosely with foil.) The cake should not look liquidy at all but will wobble just a bit when the pan is nudged; it will continue to cook as it cools. Carefully remove the roasting pan from the oven and set it on a wire rack. Cool the cheesecake in the water bath until the water is just warm, about 45 minutes. Remove the springform pan from the water bath and discard the foil. If necessary, run a thin-bladed knife around the edge of the cake to make sure it's not sticking to the sides (which can cause cracks as it cools), then cover with plastic wrap and transfer to the refrigerator to cool for at least 8 hours or overnight.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/new-york-style-cheesecake.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>For serving:</strong> Remove the sides of the springform pan. Serve the cheesecake right from the base of the pan; or, to transfer it to a serving platter, run a long, thin spatula between the crust and the pan bottom, and then use two large spatulas to carefully transfer the cheesecake to a serving dish. Slice with a sharp knife, wiping the knife clean between slices. Serve with <a href=\"https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/berry-sauce.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">berry sauce</a>, if you like.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/new-york-style-cheesecake.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>Make Ahead:</strong> The cheesecake can be made and stored in the springform pan in the fridge, tightly covered with plastic wrap, up to two days ahead of time. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/new-york-style-cheesecake.html#fv-recipe-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>Freezer-Friendly Instructions:</strong> The cheesecake can be frozen for up to 3 months. To freeze, place the cake in the freezer briefly, unwrapped, to firm it up. Then double-wrap it tightly with aluminum foil or plastic freezer wrap, or place it in heavy-duty freezer bag. Thaw in the refrigerator the night before you plan to eat it.  ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/new-york-style-cheesecake.html#fv-recipe-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pro Tip: Springform pans are notorious for leaking. Since a cheesecake bakes in a water bath, the foil prevents the water from seeping in during baking. Please do not attempt to use standard 12-inch (30cm) aluminum foil \u2013 you can\u2019t have any foil seams on the bottom or sides of the pan. No matter how well (or how many times) you wrap the pan, if there are seams exposed to the water, the water will find a way in. Even when wrapped properly, you can occasionally get some condensation inside the foil. If this happens, don\u2019t worry \u2013 the crust is likely just a bit moist around the edges. Simply remove the sides of the springform pan before refrigerating and let it dry out in the refrigerator. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/new-york-style-cheesecake.html#fv-recipe-step-9"}], "recipeIngredient": ["1\u00bd cups graham cracker crumbs, from 12 whole crackers", "5 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted", "2 tablespoons  sugar", "\u215b teaspoon salt", "32 oz (four 8-oz blocks) cream cheese, at room temperature", "2 cups sugar ", "3 tablespoons all-purpose flour", "4 teaspoons vanilla extract", "1 teaspoon packed lemon zest, from 1 lemon", "2 teaspoons fresh lemon juice, from 1 lemon ", "\u00bc teaspoon salt", "6 large eggs ", "\u00bd cup sour cream", " Special equipment: 9- or 10-inch springform pan; 18-inch heavy-duty aluminum foil (see Pro Tip)", " Berry sauce, for serving (optional)"], "recipeYield": "8 to 10", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/12/cheesecake-1200x1393.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/12/cheesecake-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/12/cheesecake-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/12/cheesecake-480x270.jpg"], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 4.8, "ratingCount": "1056"}, "datePublished": "2022-02-08T10:31:20-05:00", "keywords": "All Seasons, Christmas, Comfort Food, Cream Cheese, Easter, Father's Day, Graham Crackers, Mother's Day, Sour Cream, Springform Pan, Thanksgiving", "recipeCuisine": "American", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

oven rack in the middle position. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Using a dark marker, draw a 9-in (23-cm) diameter circle on the parchment paper by tracing around a 9-in (23-cm) cake pan or plate. Flip the paper over so your meringue won&#39;t touch the marker.", "name": "Preheat the oven to 300\u00b0F (150\u00b0C) and set an oven rack in the middle position. Increase the speed to medium-high and gradually add the sugar; continue beating until stiff peaks form, 8 to 9 minutes. (The meringue will be glossy.)", "name": "In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the whisk attachment, beat the egg whites and salt on medium speed until foamy soft peaks form, about a minute. Increase the speed to medium-high and gradually add the sugar; continue beating until stiff peaks form, 8 to 9 minutes. (The meringue will be glossy.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/double-chocolate-pavlova-with-marscapone-cream-raspberries.html#wprm-recipe-77559-step-0-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pass the cocoa powder through a sieve or sifter and add to the meringue. Add the vinegar and chopped chocolate. Using a large rubber spatula, fold the mixture until well combined. It should be a light mocha color with no white or brown streaks.", "name": "Pass the cocoa powder through a sieve or sifter and add to the meringue. Add the vinegar and chopped chocolate. Using a large rubber spatula, fold the mixture until well combined. It should be a light mocha color with no white or brown streaks.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/double-chocolate-pavlova-with-marscapone-cream-raspberries.html#wprm-recipe-77559-step-0-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Secure the parchment paper to the baking sheet by adding a dab of meringue under each corner. Mound the meringue onto the parchment inside the circle. Using the spatula or a butter knife, spread the meringue to fill the circle. Even the top and sides just slightly -- it shouldn\u2019t be perfectly smooth or overworked. Place in the oven and cook for 65 to 75 minutes, or until the meringue is puffed and crisp all over, yet still a bit wobbly underneath if you touch the center. Don't worry if the top is cracked -- that's normal and it all gets covered with whipped cream in the end. Turn off the oven, prop the oven door open, and leave the meringue in the oven to cool to room temperature, at least 30 minutes. (The meringue won\u2019t collapse as much if it cools gradually.)", "name": "Secure the parchment paper to the baking sheet by adding a dab of meringue under each corner. Mound the meringue onto the parchment inside the circle. Using the spatula or a butter knife, spread the meringue to fill the circle. Even the top and sides just slightly -- it shouldn\u2019t be perfectly smooth or overworked. Place in the oven and cook for 65 to 75 minutes, or until the meringue is puffed and crisp all over, yet still a bit wobbly underneath if you touch the center. Don't worry if the top is cracked -- that's normal and it all gets covered with whipped cream in the end. Turn off the oven, prop the oven door open, and leave the meringue in the oven to cool to room temperature, at least 30 minutes. (The meringue won\u2019t collapse as much if it cools gradually.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/double-chocolate-pavlova-with-marscapone-cream-raspberries.html#wprm-recipe-77559-step-0-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Before serving, carefully peel the meringue off of the parchment paper and place it on a serving platter. In a medium bowl, beat the mascarpone cheese, heavy cream, and vanilla on medium speed until just combined. Gradually add the sugar and continue beating until it holds soft, pillowy peaks. Do not overbeat; it should not be too stiff or grainy. Mound the mascarpone cream onto the meringue and gently spread it out about 1 in (2.5 cm) from the edge (don&#39;t worry if the meringue cracks in the process). Top the pavlova with the raspberries and sprinkle the shaved chocolate over top. Cut the pavlova into wedges, wiping the knife in between slices, and serve.", "name": "Before serving, carefully peel the meringue off of the parchment paper and place it on a serving platter. In a medium bowl, beat the mascarpone cheese, heavy cream, and vanilla on medium speed until just combined. Gradually add the sugar and continue beating until it holds soft, pillowy peaks. Do not overbeat; it should not be too stiff or grainy. Mound the mascarpone cream onto the meringue and gently spread it out about 1 in (2.5 cm) from the edge (don&#39;t worry if the meringue cracks in the process). Top the pavlova with the raspberries and sprinkle the shaved chocolate over top. Cut the pavlova into wedges, wiping the knife in between slices, and serve.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/double-chocolate-pavlova-with-marscapone-cream-raspberries.html#wprm-recipe-77559-step-0-4"}], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": "4.88", "ratingCount": "156", "reviewCount": "5"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "reviewBody": "Hi Jenn, do you think it makes any difference if I use white wine vinegar (or even white vinegar) instead of red wine vinegar for the pavlova base? "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Fill a small saucepan with about 1 inch of water. Bring to a simmer on the stove over medium-low heat. Line two 13x18-inch baking sheets with parchment paper or Silpat baking mats. Place a pastry bag fitted with a \u00bc or \u00bd-inch tip in a wide glass with the tip at the bottom of the glass but facing up (this prevents the batter from spilling out when you fill the bag). Fold the bag over the rim of the glass to form a cuff.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/macarons.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl, sift the almond flour and confectioners' sugar together through a fine sieve. Alternatively, if your almond flour is too coarse to go through the sieve, whisk the confectioners sugar and almond flour in a bowl, rubbing out any stubborn lumps with your fingers.  ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/macarons.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the egg whites and granulated sugar to the bowl of a stand mixer; whisk to combine. Place the bowl over the saucepan of simmering water, making sure the bottom of the bowl is not touching the water. Whisk constantly until the sugar is completely dissolved and the egg whites are very warm to the touch, about 2 minutes. (To see if it's ready, rub the mixture between your fingers; you shouldn't be able to feel any sugar granules.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/macarons.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the bowl from the heat and attach to the stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment. Mix on medium-high speed (speed 8) until the meringue is glossy and holds stiff peaks. For me, this takes 6 to 8 minutes, but the time will vary depending on the wattage and size of your mixer. You'll know it's ready when you lift the whisk out of the bowl and the peaks stand straight up.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/macarons.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour the sifted almond flour and confectioners' sugar mixture into the bowl with the meringue. Add the vanilla bean paste and food color. Using a rubber spatula, fold until evenly incorporated. At this point, the batter will be very thick. To achieve the right consistency, continue folding, occasionally smearing the batter against the bottom and sides of the bowl, until it is glossy with a lava-like consistency. This process is called \"macronage.\" The time it takes to reach the proper consistency varies, but it usually takes me 5 to 8 minutes (it's an arm workout!). You'll know it's ready when you can lift up the spatula and slowly form several figure 8s with the batter without the ribbon breaking. Additionally, the batter from your figure 8s should dissolve into the batter that\u2019s already in the bowl, just leaving a faint outline, in 10 to 15 seconds. Be careful not to overmix or you'll end up with macaron puddles; it's always best to undermix and test several times until the proper consistency has been achieved.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/macarons.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Transfer the batter to the pastry bag. Hold the bag straight up and down, perpendicular to the pan, about \u00bd inch above it, and pipe out 1\u00bc-inch diameter mounds onto the parchment paper. (To avoid leaving a point on the mounds, finish piping by releasing pressure and pulling up as you quickly twist with a flick of your wrist.) Tap each tray several times on the countertop to pop any air bubbles. Use a toothpick to pop any remaining air bubbles on the surface of the shells. Allow the trays to rest for about 20 minutes, or until the shells have dried out slightly.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/macarons.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 325\u00b0F and set an oven rack in the middle position.  ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/macarons.html#fv-recipe-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake one pan at a time, for 12 to 14 minutes, or until the tops are shiny and crisp. Set the pans on wire racks and let cool completely.  ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/macarons.html#fv-recipe-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Fill the macarons: Prepare your filling of choice. Remove the macarons from the parchment paper, and turn half of them over. Pipe or spoon about 2 teaspoons of the filling in the center of one upside-down macaron. Top with a second macaron and press gently to spread the filling to the edges. Repeat with the remaining macarons. Store the macarons in a covered container in the refrigerator for up to 2 days; bring to room temperature before serving.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/macarons.html#fv-recipe-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make-Ahead/Freezing Instructions: You can make the shells up to a day ahead of making the final macarons; store in a covered container in the refrigerator. (It's fine to stack the shells; just be gentle with them.) You can also freeze the shells in a tightly sealed container for up to two weeks. Make sure to thaw them in the refrigerator for a few hours before assembling.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/macarons.html#fv-recipe-step-10"}], "recipeIngredient": ["105 grams  finely sifted or super-fine almond flour", "105 grams  confectioners' sugar  ", "100 grams  egg whites, from approximately 3 large eggs   ", "100 grams granulated sugar ", "1 teaspoon vanilla bean paste (available in the baking aisle of most supermarkets) ", "1 to 2 drops  gel paste food color", " Filling of choice, such as Swiss meringue buttercream, cream cheese frosting, or chocolate ganache", " Heavy-duty stand mixer", " Digital scale", " Pastry bag with a \u00bc or \u00bd-inch tip", " Parchment paper or Silpat baking mat/template"], "recipeYield": "40 macaron shells (20 macarons)", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2022/10/macarons-1200x833.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2022/10/macarons-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2022/10/macarons-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2022/10/macarons-480x270.jpg"], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 5, "ratingCount": "6"}, "datePublished": "2023-04-04T08:47:30-04:00", "keywords": "Easter, Mother's Day, Spring", "recipeCuisine": "French", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

Add the buttermilk and stir until just combined and evenly moistened. It will look lumpy; that's good. Do not overmix.", "name": "Make the Biscuit Topping: In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, 6 tablespoons of the sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Add the cold butter and smoosh with your fingers (or cut in with a pastry cutter) until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs with pea-sized clumps of butter within. Add the buttermilk and stir until just combined and evenly moistened. It will look lumpy; that's good.
